parameters.__custom_action_script__:
#coding: utf-8
import workflow

# Get the custom parameters as a dictionary (titles are keys):
params = workflow.get_parameters()
# Get the action's input (a string):
action_in = workflow.get_input()

#...

workflow.set_output(action_in)

FC96ABC9-B5A3-469D-9F5D-1426B6981116.text:
This very useful Workflow uses a Custom Action to allow you to run several independent python scripts as one python script.

One issue I am seeing is that Editorial exports parameters alphabetically, and not in the order they appear.

Also, the order in which the various functions are called determine whether other functions get called at all.

Calling a console alert before a UI sheet presentation, will never display the UI.

If anyone has a fix, please comment.

Example scripts are included by default

parameters.__custom_action_script__:
#coding: utf-8
import workflow

# Get the custom parameters as a dictionary (titles are keys):
params = workflow.get_parameters()
# Get the action's input (a string):
action_in = workflow.get_input()

#...
parameters = []
for p in params:
	parameters.append(params[p])

##workflow.set_output(params['Script 1'] + '\n' + params['Script 2'])

#::-1 reverses the list
# and so does .reverse()

##workflow.set_output('\n'.join(parameters[::-1]))
##parameters.reverse()

#workflow.set_output('\n'.join(parameters))

source = '\n'.join(parameters)

exec source
